channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jared Polis Becomes the First Democratic Governor to Back Trump’s School-Choice Plan
item.description: The Colorado governor’s move to boost educational options is one his fellow Democrats should follow.

item.title: White House rebuffs Catholic bishops' appeal for a Christmas pause in immigration enforcement
item.description: Florida's Catholic bishops appealed to President Donald Trump on Monday to pause immigration enforcement activities during the Christmas holidays. The...

item.title: 6 ‘unhinged’ things Spanx founder Sara Blakely did that ultimately shaped the success of her $1.2 billion empire
item.description: Blakely became the first self-made female billionaire in 2012.

item.title: NASCAR Legend Greg Biffle Died An American Hero
item.description: Greg Biffle not only succeeded in the highest levels of stock car racing but also helped his suffering fellow citizens after Hurricane Helene.

item.title: 5 Years Too Late, Fulton County Proves Trump’s Call To Raffensperger Right
item.description: If nothing comes of Fulton County’s admission, the implication will be that election laws can be treated as optional rather than binding.

item.title: Trump official freezes millions in SBA aid to Minnesota, slams Walz’s policies as breeding ‘endemic’ fraud
item.description: Trump official halts $5.5 million in Minnesota SBA aid, citing "endemic" fraud under Gov. Walz's leadership in 2025 federal crackdown on welfare abuse...

item.title: Former GOP Sen. Ben Sasse reveals stage-4 cancer diagnosis: 'It's a death sentence'

item.title: Why restricting graduate loans will bankrupt America’s talent supply chain
item.description: The K-shaped divide is no longer confined to the labor market. It’s now embedded in its foundation: education.

item.title: House GOP Whip Tom Emmer targets Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz for social services fraud scandal
item.description: House Majority Whip Tom Emmer, the highest-ranking Minnesotan in Congress, is demanding accountability in his state's social services fraud scandal.

item.title: Federal watchdog finds Medicaid wasted more than $200 million on dead enrollees in single year
item.description: Medicaid programs made more than $200 million in improper payments to health care providers between 2021 and 2022 for people who had already died, acc...

item.title: No, the USS Liberty Attack Wasn’t Israeli Treachery
item.description: A half-century-old theory that the Jewish state deliberately attacked the USS Liberty during the Six-Day War has renewed currency.

item.title: Good Men Are Hard To Find, So Why Are So Many Women Divorcing Them?
item.description: Divorcing a good man is not an act of bravery but an act of self-destruction that harms many others in the process.

item.title: ‘E Pluribus Unum’ Means That We’re One People, Not A ‘Nation Of Immigrants’
item.description: The U.S. is not for everyone. To keep the founding fathers' vision alive, it must be exclusive. We are not open to all comers.

item.title: The Fed’s Phantom Tradeoff
item.description: A predictable, rules-based monetary policy would deliver the price stability that labor markets require to thrive.

item.title: A huge chunk of U.S. GDP growth is being kept alive by AI spending ‘with no guaranteed return,’ Deutsche Bank says
item.description: “Investment in AI-related sectors is critical to GDP growth [and the] US would be close to recession this year if it weren’t for tech-related spending...

item.title: Google Cloud chief reveals the long game: a decade of silicon and the energy battle behind the AI boom
item.description: "We've worked on TPUs since 2014 ... a long time before AI was fashionable," Thomas Kurian said at the Fortune Brainstorm AI conference.

item.title: How The Southern Baptist Convention Blew Up Its Credibility To Appease The #MeToo Movement
item.description: The Southern Baptist Convention has squandered much of its moral credibility crusading for leftist causes, such as amnesty and DEI.

item.title: Jay Kelly, or Why I Skipped the Sergio Leone Award
item.description: Jay Kelly reminds us that home isn’t merely a place to which you return. It’s a presence you build through daily acts of attention.

item.title: When White’s Not Right
